content.description: Choss.edu is a VB that uses the big inverted triangle Undercling to stand start and work up the right side of the boulder on the path of least resistance
content.location:
Choss Boss is 0.2 miles (350 yds west of Big Whiskey / Lost City parking pullout which shows up as Buffalo Gap in google maps. The boulder is just 30’ to the north of HWY 49.  

 (34.748864, -98.765920)

content.description: Choss Toss (V2) uses a LH crimp and RH jug to sit start on the right side of the boulder and move up and left at 10 o’clock to jugs and hand jams. Make the barn door turn around an awesome matched layback jug and make a big move to the Topout holds. Problem was named when a large block blew off during FA’s Flash Go.Fun juggy moves a few steps off the road.
content.location:
Choss Boss boulder is 0.2 miles (350 yds west of Big Whiskey / Lost City parking pullout which shows up as Buffalo Gap in google maps. The boulder is just 30’ to the north of HWY 49.  

 (34.748864, -98.765920)

content.description: Choss Hoss (V1) is a stand start problem that utilizes and Undercling start on two inverted triangle underclings and moves directly up on thinner holds on the sloping bulge and topout. This is a good warmup for the harder problems.
content.location:
Choss Boss is 0.2 miles (350 yds west of Big Whiskey / Lost City parking pullout which shows up as Buffalo Gap in google maps. The boulder is just 30’ to the north of HWY 49.  

 (34.748864, -98.765920)

content.description: Choss Boss (V3) uses the Undercling sit start on the left side of the boulder and works up through the central bulge of the boulder with a jug left hand and slopers and crimps for right hand. This is an awkward hard sit start that stays funky to the top! Hardest problem on the rock.
content.location:
Choss Boss is 0.2 miles (350 yds west of Big Whiskey / Lost City parking pullout which shows up as Buffalo Gap in google maps. The boulder is just 30’ to the north of HWY 49.  

 (34.748864, -98.765920)

content.description: Choss Boss sits just a few feet north of HWY 49 as you head west toward the edge of the WMWR.Choss Boss hosts 2 easier stand start problems and a few true sit start from the ground problems.Choss Toss (V2) uses a LH crimp and RH jug to sit start on the right side of the boulder and move up and left at 10 o’clock to jugs and hand jams. Make the barn door turn around a layback jug and make a big move to the Topout holds. Problem was named when a large block blew off during FA’s Flash Go.Choss Boss (V3) uses the Undercling sit start on the left side of the boulder and works up through the central bulge of the boulder with a jug left hand and slopers and crimps for right hand. This is an awkward hard sit start that stays funky to the top! Hardest problem on the rock.Choss Hoss (V1) is a stand start problem that utilizes an Undercling start on two inverted triangle underclings and moves directly up on thinner holds on the sloping bulge and topout. This is a good warmup for the harder problems.Choss.edu is a VB that uses the big inverted triangle Undercling to stand start and work up the right side of the boulder on the path of least resistance.Since there are many good holds, other fun lines exist like Choss Boss sit start linked to the crack exit. Or Choss Boss SS directly vertical.If you find a fun variation or harder problem please document it and it can be updated on the topo.
